name: Use time anchors to estimate clock offset
description: Correlate timestamps from the system clock and an external trusted time source (Time Anchoring)
details: Correlate timestamps from the system clock and an external trusted source of time contained in the same artifact, allowing an offset to be estimated *for the point in time the timestamp was recorded*
examples: Browser caches often contain local timestamps and those derived from external servers
Records in web browser history databases contain local timestamps and, in some cases, timestamps from external servers, embedded in URLs
Email headers often record timestamps derived from external mail servers as well as timestamps generated by the local system time

Missed call or voicemail notification messages often include a timestamp derived from an external time source, e.g., missed call from XX on 2018-06-06 at 01:32:49 pm, which can be compared to the local file system time the message was received
references: C. Vanini, C. Hargreaves, H. van Beek, F. Breitinger, 2024, Was the clock correct? Exploring timestamp interpretation through time anchors for digital forensic event reconstruction, Forensic Science International: Digital Investigation, 10.1016/j.fsidi.2024.301759
